#Text=Philip of Aragon
#Text=Philip of Aragon
#Text=[ lower-alpha 1 ]
#Text=( born between 1449 and 1456 , died 1488 ) was the Archbishop of Palermo from 31 January 1477 , when he received confirmation of his election from Sixtus IV until he renounced his see in 1485 .
#Text=Birth and early childhood
#Text=Philip was the eldest son of Charles , Prince of Viana , by his third known mistress , Brianda de Vega . [ lower-alpha 2 ]
#Text=His father was the heir of the kingdom of Navarre as the son of King John II and Queen Blanche I .
#Text=Philip and his mother are both mentioned for the first time in a document of 13 January 1456 , when they were living in Pamplona , in a house owned by the prior of Larraga .
#Text=Already by that time , Philip had been granted the title Count of Beaufort .
#Text=By February , Charles had provided his son with a room in the royal palace . [ 1 ]
#Text=Philip was born in the diocese of Pamplona , but the date of his birth is unclear .
#Text=According to some sources , he was twenty-seven years old when he was elected archbishop , which places his birth in 1449 or 1450 . [ 2 ]
#Text=According to others , his birth most likely took place shortly before he and his mother were first recognised in an official document of the prince 's in January 1456 . [ 1 ]
#Text=Philip spent most of his childhood in Barcelona .
#Text=He and his mother were first summoned there by Charles in 1461 , arriving by June .
#Text=According to Jerónimo Zurita , writing a century later , they lived in the house of Charles 's sister , Blanche .

#Text=Zurita also claims that Charles placed Philip in the charge of a knight named Bernat Sapila and separated him from his mother , although there is little evidence of this in the primary sources .
#Text=In September , Charles died .
#Text=On 5 October , in his first known public appearance , Philip took part in the funeral cortege through the streets of Barcelona . [ 1 ]

#Text=During the war against John II ( 1462 – 72 ) , Philip continued to live in Barcelona and receive a daily pension of six sueldos from the anti-kings elected in opposition to John , Peter(V ) and René .

#Text=From Peter he received gifts : a mansion near the monastery of Santa Anna that had previously belonged to Bernat Terré y Dusay and all the goods confiscated from Nicolau Carròs d'Arborea i de Mur , a support of John II .
#Text=René placed the young Philip under the protection of his son , John II , Duke of Lorraine .
#Text=Towards the end of the civil war , however , Philip switched his support to John II .
#Text=René confiscated the house by Santa Anna , but in October 1472 Barcelona was occupied by John II . [ 1 ]
#Text=Archiepiscopate
#Text=As was common in that time , Philip did not live in Palermo , but delegated his administrative duties to two vicars .
#Text=The vicars were prevented from taking up their office by the senate of the Kingdom of Sicily because they were not Sicilians .
#Text=Only after lengthy negotiations did Philip nominate a Sicilian canon to the vicariate .
#Text=The senate still refused to recognise Philip 's appointment as Grand Chancellor of the Realm , because he was not a Sicilian citizen .
#Text=Likewise , the senate even challenged his archiepiscopal election because of an irregularity in the papal rescript of confirmation .
#Text=Finally , on 9 January 1479 , the viceroy , Juan Ramón Folch de Cardona , invested him with the temporalities of his diocese .
#Text=In 1481 , Philip acquired the abbey of San Giovanni degli Eremiti and the priory of Santissima Trinità di Delia for the diocese .
#Text=He also acquired the fiefs of Geracello and Sattabene along with other lands in the Val di Mazara for the church .
#Text=After all the trouble of getting himself installed in his see , he renounced it in 1485 in order to become the Grand Master of the Order of Montesa .
#Text=He returned to Spain , where he died taking part in the War of Granada in 1488 .
